basics.name: Mingi Kang

basics.summary: Undergraduate researcher in computer science, focusing on computer vision and deep learning.

work.name: Computational Imaging Group, Washington University in St. Louis

work.name: Ungated Research, Bowdoin College
work.summary: Publicly available platform for working papers from economic journals.

work.name: Lexicon Lab, Bowdoin College
work.summary: Investigated semantic, phonological, and frequency-based influences on memory search in individuals with cochlear implants and normal hearing.

work.summary: Serving as Learning Assistant (LA) for MATH 1300: Introduction to Statistics at Bowdoin College, assisting students in understanding fundamental statistics concepts and data analysis techniques.

awards.title: NSF Student Faculty Research Grant Fellowship
awards.summary: Awarded for cognitive science research focused on modeling search within the mental lexicon, involving the development and implementation of experiments and models related to memory search and retrieval under NSF-funded faculty mentorship.

awards.title: QuestBridge National College Match Finalist
awards.summary: Recognized as a finalist for the QuestBridge National College Match.

publications.name: Structures and process-level lexical interactions in memory search: A case study of individuals with cochlear implants and normal hearing
publications.publisher: In Proceedings of the 46th Annual Meeting of the Cognitive Science Society
publications.summary: Searching through memory is mediated by complex interactions between the underlying mental lexicon and the processes that operate on this lexicon. However, these interactions are difficult to study due to the effortless manner in which neurotypical individuals perform cognitive tasks.

projects.name: Polar Shuttle
projects.summary: PolarShuttle is a mobile application designed to track real-time shuffle schedulers specifically for Bowdoin College's shuttle service.

projects.name: SiFT-v1.0
projects.summary: SiFT: Simple File Transfer is a secure file transfer system designed to allow clients to perform file operations on a server remotely.

projects.name: MealMessenger
projects.summary: MealMessenger is a service that sends daily Bowdoin dining hall menus via SMS to students.
